Going Social (for Authentication)

I was recently working on a project (coming soon) and like many web sites I needed a way to store and authenticate my users.

Its taken for granted that we are inundated with user accounts, so as a software developer I just could not find it in me to create yet-another-implementation of a login system. One more password for people to use.

Instead, I chose to go with Janrain [LINK], which enables your users to log in to your site via a number of social networks and Open ID providers.

This is a problem that needs to be solved as a whole, but not necessarily centrally. That is not to say the centralizers dont have a grand vision of their own.

Egeste story of getting into a site via leveraging anonymity.
